TIMOLOL MALEATE

BETA-ADRENOCEPTOR BLOCKERS (SYSTEMIC)

  • Indications and doses
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Cautions
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Hypertension,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 10 mg daily in 1–2 divided doses, then increased if necessary up to 60 mg daily, doses to be increased gradually. Doses above 30 mg daily given in divided doses, usual maintenance 10–30 mg daily; maximum 60 mg per day.

Angina,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 5 mg twice daily, then increased in steps of 10 mg/24 hours every 3–4 days (max. per dose 30 mg twice daily).

Prophylaxis after myocardial infarction,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 5 mg twice daily for 2 days, then increased if tolerated to 10 mg twice daily.

Migraine prophylaxis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    10–20 mg daily in 1–2 divided doses.

Reduction of intra-ocular pressure in primary open-angle glaucoma,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply twice daily.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With oral use

Dose reduction may be necessary.

Advice regarding renal impairment

With oral use

Manufacturer advises caution—dose reduction may be required.

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

notKnown: anaphylaxis, blepharoconjunctivitis, burning, corneal disorders, dry eyes, erythema, itching, ocular stinging, pain,

When used by eye

Systemic absorption can follow topical application to the eyes; consider side effects listed for systemically administered beta blockers.

Cautions regarding administration

  • When used by eye: consider also cautions listed for systemically administered beta blockers
  • When used by eye: patients with corneal disease

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

When used by eye

Although multi-dose timolol eye drops commonly contain preservatives, preservative-free unit dose vials may be available.

Prepared medicinal forms of TIMOLOL MALEATE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: eye drops,
Tablet
Eye drops
Eye gel
